perturbation.original_text: (c) "MS Licensed Materials" means collectively, to the extent owned by a member of the MS Provider Group, any hardware settings and configurations, generic software libraries and routines, and generic document templates not separately commercialized by the MS Provider Group (as defined below) and used by MSCI prior to the Trigger Date. For the avoidance of doubt, the MS Licensed Materials does not include (i) any patent, trademark or service mark of the MS Provider Group, or (ii) any infrastructure hardware or software (e.g., monitoring software and systems, customized operating systems (and components such as AFS, DNS, AD, etc.), and middleware). For the avoidance of doubt, the document templates do not include any references to members of the MS Provider Group or its personnel.
perturbation.changed_text: (c) "MS Licensed Materials" means collectively, any materials licensed to MSCI, regardless of ownership. For the avoidance of doubt, the MS Licensed Materials does not exclude any patent, trademark or service mark of the MS Provider Group, or any infrastructure hardware or software. For the avoidance of doubt, the document templates include references to members of the MS Provider Group or its personnel.
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of "MS Licensed Materials" specifies ownership by the MS Provider Group and excludes certain items. The modified definition broadens the scope to include any materials licensed to MSCI, regardless of ownership, and removes the exclusions for patents, trademarks, infrastructure hardware/software, and references to MS Provider Group personnel. This creates a contradiction because the original definition is limited and the changed definition is broad, potentially leading to disputes over what is considered "Licensed Materials" and violating intellectual property laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Intellectual Property Law, Contract Law - specifically concerning the clarity and enforceability of definitions within contracts.

perturbation.original_text: MS hereby grants (subject to any existing third party contractual obligations) to MSCI a non-exclusive, perpetual, irrevocable, world- wide, royalty-free license for MSCI to use, modify, copy, create derivative works of and sublicense, for any business purpose, the MS Licensed Materials.
perturbation.changed_text: MS hereby grants (subject to any existing third party contractual obligations) to MSCI a non-exclusive, terminable at will, revocable with notice, geographically restricted, royalty-bearing license for MSCI to use, modify, copy, create derivative works of and sublicense, for any business purpose, the MS Licensed Materials.
perturbation.explanation: The original grant is perpetual, irrevocable, and royalty-free, implying long-term, unrestricted usage rights. The modified grant introduces terms that directly contradict these characteristics: "terminable at will," "revocable with notice," "geographically restricted," and "royalty-bearing." This creates uncertainty and potential legal challenges because the terms of the license are no longer clearly defined, undermining the initial grant.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law, specifically concerning the elements of a valid license and the interpretation of conflicting clauses.

perturbation.original_text: THE LICENSE GRANTS HEREUNDER ARE PROVIDED "AS-IS" WITH NO WARRANTIES, AND THE PARTIES EXPRESSLY EXCLUDE AND DISCLAIM ANY WARRANTIES UNDER OR ARISING AS A RESULT OF THIS AGREEMENT, WHETHER EXPRESS, IMPLIED OR STATUTORY, INCLUDING, WITHOUT LIMITATION, THE IMPLIED WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, TITLE, NON-INFRINGEMENT OR ANY OTHER WARRANTY WHATSOEVER.
perturbation.changed_text: THE LICENSE GRANTS HEREUNDER ARE PROVIDED with implied warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, title and non-infringement, and the parties agree to these warranties.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract explicitly disclaims all warranties, providing the license grants "AS-IS". The modified contract explicitly states that the license grants include implied warranties of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, title, and non-infringement. This creates a direct legal contradiction, as the presence or absence of warranties significantly affects liability and risk allocation under contract and commercial law.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Uniform Commercial Code (UCC), Contract Law regarding warranties and disclaimers.
